channel.title: Pc update
channel.description:
So I was stuck playing Mission Against Terror :City under fire: and I was thinking I need to update my pc so I made money and bought a video card and ram My specs are now
:Cpu: Same "Intel pentium 4, 3.20ghz" :Graphics card: "Was intel 945g" So I think I updated pretty good for 30 bucks, :Inno3d nvidia geforce 8400: with 1gb ddr3 :Ram: 4gbs, Hdd, also updated to a 750 gb sata hdd and os "Nasty ass Windows 8"
Is it good or bad? I can play fallout new vegas on med setting
:Post your specs lets compare: Im sure imma get owned but lets see
The video card I bought "http://www.ebay.com/itm/Inno3D-nVidia-GeForce-1GB-DDR3-VGA-DVI-HDMI-PCI-Express-x-16-Video-graphics-Card-/380583823810?pt=PCC_Video_TV_Cards&hash=item589c9049c2"

item.title: Pc update
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:20, topic:545716”][quote author=RUNE-PK link=topic=664599.msg4442978#msg4442978 date=1407478201]
Yeah i know my job pays 10 an hour so I am getting there
[/quote]

10 an hour?! I get 7.50 and I was able to build my budget gaming pc for $300 in about a month[/quote]

Yeah but do you work everyday? I work every other day and not in no damn office either, I’m a Roofer My crew rips the old shingles and paper down and the other crew puts new ones on, it takes us like a day and a half to rip the roof off and then we wait like 3 days to get another job its a little town

Read full topic

Yeah i know my job pays 10 an hour so I am getting there

10 an hour?! I get 7.50 and I was able to build my budget gaming pc for $300 in about a month
[/quote]
do you have, like, bills[/quote]

@RUNE-PK maybe he was referring to me.

@Death Style yes – about $150 a month for car insurance, phone bill, gas, few other small things. i just work a crap ton of hours.

Read full topic

item.title: Pc update
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“RUNE-PK, post:13, topic:545716”][quote author=Spades link=topic=664599.msg4442966#msg4442966 date=1407463356]
Those are not good for gaming at all. I would recommend building a new computer.
[/quote]

I am trying lol Im not rich dude if I were I wouldnt be using junk from 8 years ago

What should I run in to get maximum performance?

I’d lower the resolution the resolution to 720p (1024x720). 960p is too demanding a resolution for that graphics card I think. 720p still looks nice on smaller monitors (I’m assuming you’re using a 17-19 inch 4:3 monitor).

The one is 17 sits in the corner for movies and such the other is a widescreen Im not sure how big it is but its pretty good sized I guess for a monitor my guess is probably a 25 inch lol[/quote]

I’d recommend saving up some money and try to buy some parts. You can get a decent gaming computer for $500 bucks.

Read full topic

item.title: Pc update
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

Spades:

Those are not good for gaming at all. I would recommend building a new computer.

I am trying lol Im not rich dude if I were I wouldnt be using junk from 8 years ago

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:10, topic:545716”][quote author=RUNE-PK link=topic=664599.msg4442961#msg4442961 date=1407462332]
What should I run in to get maximum performance?
[/quote]
I’d lower the resolution the resolution to 720p (1024x720). 960p is too demanding a resolution for that graphics card I think. 720p still looks nice on smaller monitors (I’m assuming you’re using a 17-19 inch 4:3 monitor).[/quote]

The one is 17 sits in the corner for movies and such the other is a widescreen Im not sure how big it is but its pretty good sized I guess for a monitor my guess is probably a 25 inch lol

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xEthanx xEthanx
item.description:
@xEthanx wrote:

I’d say for a gaming PC it seems average. You won’t be playing any BF4 on ultra or anything but it can probably play most games on medium settings.
